Detailed Description

Interface class for routes.

Member Function Documentation

void WFAPI::RouteInterface::addRouteListener ( RouteListener *  listener  ) 

Add a listener for route callbacks.

See also:
RouteListener
Parameters:
listener The RouteListener to add. It may not be deleted until it is removed by calling removeRouteListener.

RouteInterfaceImpl* WFAPI::RouteInterface::getImpl (  ) 

Internal function.

SynchronousStatus WFAPI::RouteInterface::getRouteList ( RouteInfoItemArray &  routeInfoList  ) 

Get the itinerary for the current route.

Parameters:
routeInfoList Filled with the route turn for the current route.
Returns:
StatusCodes::OK if operation succeeded.

SynchronousStatus WFAPI::RouteInterface::removeRoute (  ) 

Stop and remove the current route.

Returns:
The status of the operation, StatusCodes::OK if operation succeeded.

void WFAPI::RouteInterface::removeRouteListener ( RouteListener *  listener  ) 

Remove a listener.

Parameters:
listener The RouteListener to remove. It should now be deleted by caller, unless caller keeps it around for later use.

AsynchronousStatus WFAPI::RouteInterface::reRoute (  ) 

This asynchronous function initiates a reroute using the current destination, current GPS position and current TransportationType. When reroute is done the added RouteListeners will get a callback with the RequestID returned by this call.

Returns:
The status and if status is OK the RequestID that will be returned in the RouteListeners routeReply function.

AsynchronousStatus WFAPI::RouteInterface::routeBetweenCoordinates ( const WGS84Coordinate &  startCoord,
const WGS84Coordinate &  destCoord,
TransportationType  transportationType 
)

This asynchronous function initiates a route using the parameters. When route is done the added RouteListeners will get a callback with the RequestID returned by this call.

Parameters:
startCoord The origin coordinate of the route.
destCoord The destination coordinate of the route.
transportationType The selected mode of transportation.
Returns:
The status and if status is OK the RequestID that will be returned in the RouteListeners routeReply function.

SynchronousStatus WFAPI::RouteInterface::routeSimulationDecreaseSpeed (  ) 

Decrease the speed of the simulation of the route. Note that a route needs to be calculated before this function is called. If no route has been calculated this function does nothing.

Returns:
The status of decrease the speed of simulation.

SynchronousStatus WFAPI::RouteInterface::routeSimulationIncreaseSpeed (  ) 

Increase the speed of the simulation of the route. Note that a route needs to be calculated before this function is called. If no route has been calculated this function does nothing.

Returns:
The status of increase the speed of simulation.

SynchronousStatus WFAPI::RouteInterface::routeSimulationPause (  ) 

Pauses simulation of a route. A call to routeSimulationResume will resume the paused simulation. Note that a route needs to be calculated before this function is called. If no route has been calculated this function does nothing.

Returns:
The status of simulation pause command, always OK.

SynchronousStatus WFAPI::RouteInterface::routeSimulationRepeatOff (  ) 

Stops repeat of route simulation.

SynchronousStatus WFAPI::RouteInterface::routeSimulationRepeatOn (  ) 

Sets the simulation of a route to repeat the route simulation. When the route is finished the simulation starts over from the beginning.

SynchronousStatus WFAPI::RouteInterface::routeSimulationResume (  ) 

Resumes a paused simulation. Note that a route needs to be calculated before this function is called. If no route has been calculated this function does nothing.

Returns:
The status of simulation resume command, always OK.

SynchronousStatus WFAPI::RouteInterface::routeSimulationStart (  ) 

Start simulation of a route. Note that a route needs to be calculated before this function is called. If no route has been calculated this function does nothing.

Returns:
The status of simulation start command, always OK.

SynchronousStatus WFAPI::RouteInterface::routeSimulationStop (  ) 

Stop simulation of a route. Note that a route needs to be calculated before this function is called. If no route has been calculated this function does nothing.

Returns:
The status of simulation stop command, always OK.

AsynchronousStatus WFAPI::RouteInterface::routeToCoordinate ( const WGS84Coordinate &  destCoord,
TransportationType  transportationType 
)

This asynchronous function initiates a route using the parameters and the current GPS position at start coordinate. When route is done the added RouteListeners will get a callback with the RequestID returned by this call.

Parameters:
destCoord The destination coordinate of the route.
transportationType The selected mode of transportation.
Returns:
The status and if status is OK the RequestID that will be returned in the RouteListeners routeReply function.

AsynchronousStatus WFAPI::RouteInterface::routeToFavourite ( const Favourite &  favourite,
TransportationType  transportationType 
)

To route to a favourite. This asynchronous function initiates a route using the parameters and the current GPS position at start coordinate. When route is done the added RouteListeners will get a callback with the RequestID returned by this call.

Parameters:
favourite The favourite to route to.
transportationType The selected mode of transportation.
Returns:
The status and if status is OK the RequestID that will be returned in the RouteListeners routeReply function.

AsynchronousStatus WFAPI::RouteInterface::routeToSearchItem ( const SearchItem &  searchItem,
TransportationType  transportationType 
)

To route to a search item. This asynchronous function initiates a route using the parameters and the current GPS position at start coordinate. When route is done the added RouteListeners will get a callback with the RequestID returned by this call.

Parameters:
searchItem The searchItem to route to.
transportationType The selected mode of transportation.
Returns:
The status and if status is OK the RequestID that will be returned in the RouteListeners routeReply function.
